Usage¶

class sim_launch_py.classes.Atom(name: str, index: int = None, atomtype: str = None, resname: str = None, coordinates: list = None, resid: int = None)¶

The atom class that stores and manage all the information and methods.

Attributes:

  • name (str) : name of the atom.

  • index (int) : atom index.

  • atomtype (str) : atom type.

  • resname (str) : name of the residue the atom is part of.

  • coordinates (list): coordinates of the atom in nm.

  • resid (int) : index of the molecule the atom is part of.

  • element (str) : chemical element of the atom.

  • mw (float) : atomic mass in Da.

  • bonds (list) : list of the index of the atoms in the same molecule that the atom is bound to.

Static Methods:

  • _getelement(atomtype) : Assign atomic element of the atom based on its name.

  • _getmw(element) : Assign mass to the atom based on its atomic element.

static _getelement(atomtype)¶

Assign atomic element of the atom based on its name.

static _getmw(element)¶

Assign mass to the atom based on its atomic element.

class sim_launch_py.classes.Molecule(name: str, resname='UNK', index=None)¶

The molecule class that stores and manage all the information and methods.

Attributes:

name : name of the molecule type resname : residue name index : index of the molecule mw : molecular weight in [Da] atoms : list of atom types of the molecule type contact_matrix : NxN matrix (N=number of atoms in the molecule) of the bonds between the atoms.

Methods:

help(): print the help for this class.

_calc_mass()¶

Compute the mass of the molecule and store it in self._mw.

_compute_contact_matrix()¶

Compute the matrix of bonds of the molecule.

_get_com()¶
_renumber_atoms()¶

Renumber the atom indexes in the molecule starting from 0.

_update_atom_resid()¶

Renumber the molecular index of the atoms (i.e. the index of the molecule they belong to).

class sim_launch_py.classes.Project(name: str, path: str)¶

The project class that stores and manage all the information and methods.

Attributes:

  • name : name of the project. This defines the directory where the project will be stored and most of path variables.

  • project_path : absolute path of the project. The name of the directory is derived from the name of the project.

  • systems_path : directory where the data of the simulated systems are stored. This is the parent directory of the systems.

  • topology_path : directory where the topology files (.top and .itp) of the molecules used in the project are stored and retrieved to be used in each system.

  • init_struct_path : path where initial structures of the molecules used in the project are stored and retrieved to be used in each system.

  • mdp_path : path where default .mdp input files for gromacs are stored.

  • pickle_path : path where the project is saved in .pkl format.

  • job_script_path : path where the template files for submission scripts are stored.

  • systems : list of System() objects in the project.

  • molecules : list of Molecule() objects in the project.

  • gromacs : path to gromacs binary.

  • ambertools : path to ambertools binaries directory.

Methods:

  • help() : print the help for this class.

  • add_system(self,name: str) : add and initialize System() to the Project().

  • new_project(name=None, path=None, overwrite=False) : create new Project().

  • save(self) : save Project() in Project().pickle_path.

  • load_project(project_folder: str) : load Project() stored in project_folde/.multisim.pkl.

  • write_sub_command(self,scriptname: str,hpc_system: str, template: str): write job submission/run scripts for the given HPC system for each System() and a global bash script to call all the job scripts.

#### TODO METHODS ####

  • change_project_path(self,newpath: str) : when implemented, it will allow to copy the project to a new path and change all the pertinent path attributes.

_checkAmberTools()¶

Look for AmberTools binaries directory and add it to the project. This method looks for the antechamber binary. If it is not found, it will prompt the user to input manually the absolute path of the ambertools binaries directory. The value of the attribute is the absolute path of antechamber (/path/to/bin/antechamber).

_checkGromacs()¶

Look for Gromacs binary and add it to the project. This method looks for standard names of gromacs binaries (i.e. ‘gmx’ and ‘gmx_mpi’). If either of these is not found, it will prompt the user to input manually the absolute path of the gromacs executable. The value of the attribute is the absolute path of the binary (/path/to/gmx or /path/to/gmx_mpi or /path/to/gmx_bin_custom_name).

_renumber_systems()¶

Renumber starting from 0 the index of the systems in a project.

add_system(name: str)¶

Add system to project

Parameters:

name (str) – system name.

property defaults_path¶

Delete a system from project and update the index of remaining systems.

Parameters:

delete_list – list of system indexes

new project

class sim_launch_py.classes.System(name: str, path=None)¶

The system class that stores and manage all the information and methods.

Attributes:

  • name : name of the system. This is used to create the directory of the system.

  • path : absolute path of the system.

  • molecules : list of Molecule() objects belonging to the system.

  • box : size of the box (of the initial configuration).

  • boxshape : shape of the simulation box.

  • simulations : list of Simulation() objects of the system.

  • run_command : command lines to be used to run the simulations.

  • gromacs : gromacs binary path, inherited from the Project().

  • composition : composition of the system. Order of values is the same of the order in self.molecules.

  • atoms : list of Atom() objects in the system.

  • natoms : total numer of atoms in the systems.

Methods:

  • help() : print the help for this class

  • add_molecule(self, name: str, moltype=None, knownmolecules=None) : add species to the system.

  • add_box(self, box_side: float, shape=’cubic’) : create simulation box.

  • createSolventBox(self, solvent: object, output_structure=”solvent_box.pdb”, density=None, nmols=None): add solvent molecules to the simulation box.

  • insertSolute(self, solute: object, solvent: object, solvent_box=”solvent_box.pdb”, concentration=0, output_structure=”start.pdb”): add solute molecules to the box and remove excess solvent molecules.

  • writeTop(self, atomtypes_path: str, molecules: objects): write the topology file for the system in gromacs format.

  • add_simulation(self, simtype: str, mdrun_options=’’, mdp=’’, print_bash=True, name=’’,maxwarn=0, start_coord=’’,gmxbin=’’): add simulation to the system.

  • print_command(self, bash_file): print the bash script file to run the simulations.

_assign_atoms_to_molecules(name: str, atoms: list)¶

Add atom objects to molecule objects.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the molecule.

  • atoms (list) – list of atom objects.

static _box_matrix(box: list)¶

Given a box vector [a, b, c, alpha, beta, gamma], compute the box matrix.

Parameters:

box (list) – box vector. box vectors (a,b,c) are assumed to be i nm, angles (alpha, beta, gamma) are assumed to be in degrees.

Returns M:

box matrix

Rtype M:

list

_loadfrommol2(name: str, mol2file: str, keep_coordinates: bool = True)¶

Load molecules from a MOL2 structure file.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the MOL2 structure file.

  • mol2file (str) – name of the MOL2 structure file.

  • keep_coordinates (bool) – keep coordinates read from the structure file. Defaults to True.

_update_coordinates(structure_file, start=0, end=inf)¶

Assign the coordinates of atoms from a PDB structure file.

Parameters:

  • structure_file (str) – PDB file from which coordinates are read.

  • start (int) – index of the first molecule of the system for which atomic coordinates are updated. Defaults to 0.

  • end (int) – index of the last molecule (included) of the system for which atomic coordinates are updated. Defaults to np.inf.

_update_molecule_indexes()¶

Renumber the indexes of the molecules (0-based).

add_box(box_side: float, shape: str = 'cubic')¶

Create simulation box.

Parameters:

  • box_side (float) – side of the box in nm.

  • shape (str) – shape of the box. Defaults to ‘cubic’.

add_molecule(name: str, structure_file: str = None, keep_coordinates: bool = True, keep_box: bool = True)¶

Add new molecules to a system starting from a structure file (e.g. a PDB file).

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the molecule.

  • structure_file (str, optional) – name of the structure file to be read. Defaults to None.

  • keep_coordinates (bool, optional) – keep the coordinates read from the structure file. Defaults to True.

  • keep_box (bool, optional) – read the box parameters from the structure file and use them to define/update the box attribute of the system. Defaults to True.

insert_molecules(name: str, molstruct: str, initial_conf: str = None, final_conf: str = 'inserted.pdb', nmol: int = 1)¶

Insert molecules in random positions.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the molecule.

  • molstruct (str) – structure file of the molecule to insert. PN: it supports only structures with a single molecule.

  • initial_conf (str, optional) – structure file into which the new molecules are inserted. Defaults to None. If no initial configuration is given, an empty box is created and populated. System.box need to have been already defined.

  • final_conf (str, optional) – final structure file (in PDB format) with the inserted molecules. Defaults to inserted.pdb.

  • nmol (int, optional) – number of molecules to insert. Defaults to 1.

property name¶
property path¶

Replicate the given box in the 3 directions.

Parameters:

repl (list, optional) – number of times the cell is replicated in each direction. Defaults to [1, 1, 1]

class sim_launch_py.gromacs.EnergyMinimization(name: str, mdrun_options: str = '', coord: str = 'start.pdb', topology: str = 'topol.top', path_mdp: str = '', path_input: str = '', path_output: str = '', print_bash: str = False, maxwarn: int = 0, gmxbin: str = 'gmx_mpi')¶
class sim_launch_py.gromacs.MD(name: str, mdrun_options: str = '', coord: str = '', topology: str = '', path_mdp: str = '', path_input: str = '', path_output: str = '', temperature: float = 300.0, thermostat: str = 'vv', pressure: float = 1, barostat: str = 'Parrinello-Rahman', nsteps: int = 100, print_bash: bool = False, maxwarn: int = 0, gmxbin: str = 'gmx_mpi', plumed: bool = None)¶
add_bias(name: str, biastype: str, cv: object, **kwargs)¶

Add a bias to the simulation

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the bias

  • biastype (str) – type of bias to apply, available types are: ‘METAD’, ‘UPPER_WALLS’, ‘LOWER_WALLS’

  • cv (object) – name of the collective variable to bias

:param **kwargs : keyword arguments that depend on the specific bias :returns new_bias: the new bias object :rtype object:

add_cv(name: str, cvtype: str, **kwargs)¶

Add a collective variable to the simulation

Parameters:

  • name (str) – name of the collective variable

  • cvtype (str) – type of collective variable, available types are: ‘TORSION’, ‘ENERGY’.

:param **kwargs : keyword arguments for the chosen type of variable :returns new_cv: the new collective variable :rtype new_cv: CV object

sim_launch_py.ffparms.extract_atomtypes_from_gmx_top(topfile: str, atomtypefile: str)¶

This function takes a gromacs topology file and extracts the atom types in the [ atomtypes ] section

Parameters:

  • topfile (str) – name of the gromacs topology (.top) file

  • atomtypefile (str) – name of the destination atom type file

sim_launch_py.ffparms.extract_molecule_from_gmx_top(topfile: str, path_itp_file: str)¶

This function takes a gromacs topology file of a single molecule type and extracts the following sections: [ moleculetype ], [ atoms ], [ bonds ], [ pairs ], [ angles ], [ dihedrals ])

Parameters:

  • topfile (str) – path of the gromacs topology (.top) file

  • path_itp_file (str) – path of the destination gromacs include topology (.itp) file

sim_launch_py.ffparms.gaff(molecule: str, path_output: str, res_name: str = 'UNK', generate_charges: str = 'bcc', atomtype: str = 'gaff2', overwrite: bool = False)¶

This function is used to compute gaff parameters for small molecules using tleap, and to transform them in a gromacs friendly form.

Parameters:

  • molecule (str) – name of the molecule

  • path_output (str) – path to output

  • res_name (str, optional) – residue name. Defaults to ‘UNK’.

  • generate_charges (str, optional) – charge assignment method. Defaults to ‘bcc’.

  • atomtype (str, optional) – atomtype scheme definition (gaff, gaff2). Defaults to ‘gaff2’.

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – overwrite existing files?. Defaults to False.

sim_launch_py.ffparms.getTop(molecule: str, fromPath: str = '', toPath: str = '')¶

obtain topology file

Parameters:

  • molecule (str) – molecule name

  • fromPath (str) – path where the topology is. Defaults to ‘’.

  • toPath (str) – path where the topology goes. Defaults to ‘’.

sim_launch_py.plumed.writePlumedFile(plumed_file: str, simulation: object, colvar: str = None, printstride: int = 500)¶

Write Plumed File

Parameters:

  • plumed_file (str) – path of the output plumed file

  • simulation – simulation with groups, cvs, and biases to use.n :type simulation: object

  • colvar (str, optional) – name of the colvar file where values of CVs will be saved. Defaults to None.

  • printstride (int, optional) – stride for output of colvar file. Defaults to 500 steps.

Estimate the number of molecules in a box at a given density

Return:

n (int) : number of molecules

sim_launch_py.external.molecules.findTorsionalAngles(structure: str, structure_format='pdb')¶
Args:

structure (str): structure file of the molecule. structure_format (str, optional): format of the structure file. Defaults to ‘pdb’.

Returns:

torsion_angle_indices (list): list of lists identifying the dihedral angles of the molecule. Values are 0-indexed.

Adapted from code by Edgar Olehnovics

sim_launch_py.external.gaussianFit.gaussianFit(dihedral_angles: str, datacol: int = 1, plotFit: bool = False)¶

Estimate fit parameters

Parameters:

  • dihedral_angles (str) – text file with the values of dihedral angles

  • datacol (int, optional) – column (0-indexed) where data is. Defaults to 1.

  • plotFit (bool, optional) – plot the original histogram and the fitted gaussians? Defaults to False.

Returns centers:

centers of the fitted distributions

Rtype centers:

list

Returns sigma:

sigma values of the fitted distributions

Rtype sigma:

list

sim_launch_py.external.gaussianFit.histogram(dihedral_angles: str, datacol: int = 1, probcutoff: float = 0.001)¶

Compute the probability distribution given a timeseries of dihedral angles

centers,histo (list,list) : centers of the bins and values of the probability distribution.

Parameters:

  • dihedral_angles (str) – text file with the timeseries. Angle values are assumed to be in the second column of the file.

  • datacol (int, optional) – column (0-indexed) where data is. Defaults to 1.

  • probcutoff (float, optional) – cutoff value for the population of a bin to take into account in the final histogram. Defaults to 0.001

Returns centers:

centers of the bins of the probability distribution.

Rtype centers:

list

Returns histo:

values of the histogram of the probability distribution

Rtype histo:

list

sim_launch_py.external.gaussianFit.sumGaussFunct(x: list, parameters: list)¶

Sum of Gaussian functions

Parameters:

  • x (list) – x axis values

  • parameters (list) – list of parameters of length 3*N where N is the number of Gaussians to estimate. Order of the parameters is A,mu,sigma.

Returns f:

y axis values

Rtype f:

list
